chara.textHome:
getting told insensitive things won't
change me. Nothing phases me.

I think being that way is very peaceful...
but it's also so boring.

TV? I almost never watch it.
The lack of reality does nothing for me.

Something physical that I can feel
is more my style.

I can feel it...
New power is surging through me.
Hm... It seems I'm somewhat excited.

My heart jumped ever so slightly...
Could this be the change
I've been searching for?

One cannot find meaning in life
only looking inward.

It is through interactions with others
that we find happiness.
For now, that is my answer.
To die is another part of my destiny.
And my life and death are mine alone.
That's what I thought...

However, should my death cause pain
to another, I believe I should resist it
with all my might.

Oh, you're here. Huh?
Nothing. No, I'm not annoyed.
Do I look like I am?
I'm neither annoyed nor happy.

I find it odd when people say, 
"What a beautiful morning!" or
 "I hate getting up in the morning!"

Getting up is nothing more than an act that
occurs day in and day out.

You haven't eaten yet, it seems.
No, I'm not inviting you to eat with me.
Doing that would be dull for you.
Did you do anything fun today? Tell me.

Perhaps hearing about the things you enjoy
will give me a clue about how I can
escape the boredom of my own life.
You're not going to sleep?
Oh, no, you're not distracting at all.
If you were,  I'd tell you.
Do what you like, and I'll do what I like.
Fighting is...scary? Why?
Because you get hurt?
It's true that getting hurt isn't pleasant.

But feeling unpleasant and being afraid 
are two completely different things.

It's almost time to leave. 
 I always do what I'm told. 
That's the fate of all Magical Girls.

I don't think that's scary or annoying...
It's just a fact of life.

Even if they look like us, there's nothing
to feel bad about. Enemies are enemies.

You can't tell anything about their
identity just by looking at them.
Though Witches are negative forces,

I also believe they are overflowing with life,
much like us.

Whenever I fight one I feel an overwhelming
energy emanating from them.

I am...at least trying to find
something I enjoy.

I did try to find a hobby for myself once,
but that didn't go very well.
Do you have things that you enjoy?
If you do, what are they?

Tell me.
How did you realize you liked those things? 
And why do you like those things?

If you're not attached to anything,
there's nothing to be angry about.
I imagine people think I'm pretty harmless.
You could say I'm boring too.
I swim,
so I smell that swimming pool smell a lot.

It doesn't relax me, but it also doesn't
annoy me... I'm just used to it.
I don't care about the things I see or hear.

The only thing that ever made me feel 
something ever so slight was becoming 
a Magical Girl.
Mitama Yakumo.

She's probably the Magical Girl 
I talk to the most after Kokoro.

She's really objective and tells it how it is,
which I like.
Kokoro Awane is a strange girl.
I don't know why she hangs around me.

What I do know is that
I don't like it when she gets hurt.

In that moment, there was nothing
in my life that I wanted except
to become a Magical Girl.

So I just wished for money.
It never hurts to have some extra money.
Seek and destroy. That's all there is to it.
How does it feel? Glad you won?
The correct response to this is joy, right?
I'm glad I managed to protect you.
How do I express these feelingsâ€¦?

I'm Masara Kagami. I'm 5' 4".
I go to school in Kamihama.
I'm a Magical Girl...
Random facts are really all I can say.
I want to become stronger.

Maybe I'll find something
that excites me then.
Yes, I'm feeling content.
Though...it's not quite the same as happy.

Perhaps heartfelt emotions are
something that can only be found by
going out and looking for them.

I don't care about setting records or anything.
I have no enthusiasm for that, but...

I do enjoy swimming.
There's a sense of tranquility under water
where only bubbles can be heard.

If I had one particular subject that I like,
it'd be modern literature.

Learning what grips the hearts and minds
of others might provide me with hints on
how to change my daily life.
